Dataset-LongName: Aquarius Official Release Level 3 Ancillary Reynolds Sea Surface Temperature Standard Mapped Image Seasonal Data V4.0
Dataset-LongName-Full: Aquarius Official Release Level 3 Ancillary Reynolds Sea Surface Temperature Standard Mapped Image Seasonal Data V4.0
Dataset-Description: Aquarius Level 3 ancillary sea surface temperature (SST) standard mapped image data are the ancillary SST data used in the Aquarius calibration for salinity retrieval.  They are simply the daily SSTs from the Reynolds National Climatic Data Center (NCDC) 0.25 degree GHRSST dataset, gridded and averaged using the Aquarius processing L2-L3 processing scheme to the same 1 degree spatial resolution and daily, 7 day, monthly, seasonal, and annual time intervals as Aquarius L3 standard salinity and wind speed products.  This particular data set is the seasonal ancillary sea surface temperature product associated with version 4.0  of the Aquarius data set, which is the official end of prime mission public data release from the AQUARIUS/SAC-D mission.
Dataset-Reference: Reynolds, R.W, T.M.Smith, C.Liu, D.B. Chelton, K.S. Casey & M.G. Schlax, 2007: Daily High-resolution Blended Analyses for sea surface temperature. J. Climate, 20, 5473-5496
Dataset-OriginalProvider: Aquarius Project NASA/OBPG, Reynolds & Smith NOAA/NCDC
Dataset-Provider-LongName: Ocean Biology Processing Group (OBPG), Global Change Data Center, Earth Sciences Division, Science and Exploration Directorate, Goddard Space Flight Center,NASA
DatasetCitation-ReleasePlace: Goddard Space Flight Center, 8800 Greenbelt Rd.; Greeenbelt, MD., 20771, USA

DatasetSource-Source-Description: In situ SST data from drifting and moored buoys, and ships at various depths.

The POES satellite system offers the advantage of daily global coverage, with morning and afternoon orbits that deliver global data, for improvement of weather forecasting. The information received includes cloud cover, storm location, temperature, and heat balance in the earth's atmosphere.

The AVHRR is a radiation-detection imager that can be used for remotely determining cloud cover and the surface temperature. Note that the term surface can mean the surface of the Earth, the upper surfaces of clouds, or the surface of a body of water.
